abstract: The type of the service associated with an outlet or a switch.
overview:
## Discussion

Because different things can be plugged into outlets or controlled by switches, there is a tight association between a switch or outlet service and another service that it controls—for example, a lamp plugged into an outlet associates a lightbulb service with the outlet, even if the lamp itself is not a supported HomeKit accessory.

The associated service can be any service defined by the HomeKit Accessory Profile that supports [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristicTypePowerState], other than [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMServiceTypeOutlet] or [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMServiceTypeSwitch].

See [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/accessory-service-types] for a list of service types.

# associatedServiceType

**Instance Property**

The type of the service associated with an outlet or a switch.

## Declaration

```swift
var associatedServiceType: String? { get }
```

## Discussion

Because different things can be plugged into outlets or controlled by switches, there is a tight association between a switch or outlet service and another service that it controls—for example, a lamp plugged into an outlet associates a lightbulb service with the outlet, even if the lamp itself is not a supported HomeKit accessory.

The associated service can be any service defined by the HomeKit Accessory Profile that supports [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristicTypePowerState], other than [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMServiceTypeOutlet] or [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMServiceTypeSwitch].

See [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/accessory-service-types] for a list of service types.

## Associating a secondary service

- **updateAssociatedServiceType(_:completionHandler:)**: Associates the service type of the plugged-in device with a switch or an outlet service.
